title: Thales Program Manager Shares Italian Lunar Habitat Details
summary: Thales Alenia Space Multi-Purpose Habitation module programme manager Nicola Genco has shared several key details about the planned first permanent human presence on the Moon. In 2022, the Italian Space Agency (ASI) signed a pair of agreements with NASA that would see ASI take the lead on the preliminary design of the lunar surface Multi-Purpose […]

title: Space Force awards $200 million contract to Northrop Grumman for UK radar site
summary: The Deep Space Advanced Radar Capability program aims to create a global network of ground-based radar systems to enhance space domain awareness by detecting and tracking objects in geosynchronous orbit

title: Blue Origin sets date for next New Shepard flight after completing parachute investigation
summary: Blue Origin has scheduled its next New Shepard suborbital mission for Aug. 29 after completing an investigation into a parachute that failed to fully open on the vehicle’s previous flight.

title: Second Tower complete at Starbase as Flight 5 preps continue
summary: SpaceX completed stacking Launch Tower 2 at Orbital Launch Pad B at Starbase, Texas, in record time, allowing for the next phase of preparations, including adding its own chopstick system. Preparations are also continuing on Orbital Launch Pad A’s Tower 1 to prepare it for the launch of Flight 5 and a possible catch of Booster 12.

title: SpaceWERX awards contracts to nine space tech firms for defense projects
summary: Nine space firms were selected for STRATFI agreements worth about $300 million in government funding

title: Supreme Court case could affect orbital debris mitigation rules
summary: A recent U.S. Supreme Court ruling could upend efforts by the Federal Communications Commission to enforce more stringent orbital debris regulations.

title: RFA pushes maiden flight to 2025 after launchpad explosion
summary: Rocket Factory Augsburg no longer plans a maiden flight this year after losing part of its RFA ONE rocket during a static-fire test, the German company said Aug. 23 as it released more details about the incident.

title: August 2024 Transformer of the Month: Selina Salgado
summary: As a Human Resource Business Partner at NASA Headquarters, Selina Salgado describes her job as helping with “all things people” for the enterprise. By facilitating technological solutions to human resources (HR) challenges and needs, she excels at an often-underestimated aspect of Digital Transformation (DT): the interpersonal side. title: NASA Ames Stars of the Month: August 2024
summary: The NASA Ames Science Directorate recognizes the outstanding contributions of (pictured left to right) Sangsavang Stevie Phothisane, Taryn Kavanagh, Andro Rios, and Hami Ray. Their commitment to the NASA mission represents the talent, camaraderie, and vision needed to explore this world and beyond. title: First Look at Hybrid Electric Research Aircraft
summary: In a special unveiling ceremony on Aug. 22, 2024, the public received a first look at magniX’s Dash 7 aircraft that will serve as a testbed for sustainable aviation research with NASA’s Electrified Powertrain Flight Demonstration (EPFD) project.  Hosted by magniX at King County International Airport, commonly known as Boeing Field, in Seattle, Washington, leaders […]
